TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CCAtlasNode extends Cocos2D.CCNodeRGBA implements class Cocos2D.ICCBlendProtocol, class Cocos2D.ICCTextureProtocol

Docs.summary: <para> <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCAtlasNode" /> is a subclass of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /> that implements the <ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_r_g_b_a_protocol" kindref="compound">RGBAProtocol</ref> and <ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_texture_protocol" kindref="compound">TextureProtocol</ref> protocol. </para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCAtlasNode" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /><ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_r_g_b_a_protocol" kindref="compound">RGBAProtocol</ref><ref refid="classcocos2d_1_1_texture_protocol" kindref="compound">TextureProtocol</ref>
Docs.remarks: <para>It knows how to render a <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTextureAtlas" /> object. If you are going to render a <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTextureAtlas" /> consider subclassing <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCAtlasNode" /> (or a subclass of <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCAtlasNode" />)</para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTextureAtlas" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCTextureAtlas" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCAtlasNode" /><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCAtlasNode" /><para>All features from <see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /> are valid, plus the following features:<list type="bullet"><item><description>opacity and RGB colors </description></item></list></para><see cref="T:Cocos2D.CCNode" /><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>opacity and RGB colors </description> </item> </list><para>opacity and RGB colors </para>

public override Cocos2D.CCColor3B Color { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Changes the color with R,G,B bytes
Docs.remarks: <para>Changes the color with R,G,B bytes</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>color</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Example: Color3B(255,100,0) means R=255, G=100, B=0 </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>color</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Example: Color3B(255,100,0) means R=255, G=100, B=0 </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>color</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>color</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>Example: Color3B(255,100,0) means R=255, G=100, B=0 </para> </parameterdescription><para>Example: Color3B(255,100,0) means R=255, G=100, B=0 </para>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Draw() cil managed

Docs.summary: Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node.
Docs.remarks: <para>Override this method to draw your own node. The following GL states will be enabled by default:<list type="bullet"><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</description></item><item><description>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </description></item></list></para><list type="bullet"> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</description> </item> <item> <description>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </description> </item> </list><para>glEnableClientState(GL_VERTEX_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnableClientState(GL_COLOR_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnableClientState(GL_TEXTURE_COORD_ARRAY);</para><para>glEnable(GL_TEXTURE_2D); AND YOU SHOULD NOT DISABLE THEM AFTER DRAWING YOUR NODE But if you enable any other GL state, you should disable it after drawing your node. </para>

Docs.remarks: <para>Changes the opacity.</para><para /><parameterlist kind="param"> <parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>value</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Goes from 0 to 255, where 255 means fully opaque and 0 means fully transparent. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem> </parameterlist><parameteritem> <parameternamelist> <parametername>value</parametername> </parameternamelist> <parameterdescription> <para>Goes from 0 to 255, where 255 means fully opaque and 0 means fully transparent. </para> </parameterdescription> </parameteritem><parameternamelist> <parametername>value</parametername> </parameternamelist><parametername>value</parametername><parameterdescription> <para>Goes from 0 to 255, where 255 means fully opaque and 0 means fully transparent. </para> </parameterdescription><para>Goes from 0 to 255, where 255 means fully opaque and 0 means fully transparent. </para>
